ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Introduction to Spanish grammar, techniques to approach Spanish translation, resources to locate Spanish-language archives
I gained a better knowledge of the Spanish language, particularly with respect to reading comprehension.
Reading comprehension skills, recognizing grammar patterns in Spanish.
I learned how to read texts in Spanish with the help of a dictionary. I learned Spanish grammar rules, conjugations, and sentence structure, among other things.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course instructors provided excellent feedback and encouragement. I found that there were some grading discrepancies between the graders (e.g. one grader preferring more literal translations, another preferring more idiomatic), but nothing major. I would have liked even more practice with more passages or longer passages!

The strengths are its excellent content, video-lectures, and accessibility. In regards to an area of improvement, I would suggest a follow-up to pair students with tutors after the completion of the course, if they are preparing for language comps.
Great balance of reading/translating each day, and I felt like it was not an overwhelming amount of work. Good, prompt feedback as well.

I think it can be a bit difficult to take an asynchronous course and feel like we are all learning together. The feedback given by the instructors was a huge strength of this course, and I appreciated their attentiveness to our translations.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to another student because I feel better prepared for my language comps.
Definitely! Easy way to complete the language requirement, but I do also feel that my translation skills got a boost!
Yes, I think it gives a good overview of Spanish grammar and skills needed for reading comprehension.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I have built a foundation upon which I plan to prepare for my comps.
Will help me in archive research when I need to translate documents from Spanish.
I will be able to use the skills learned to do archival research with Spanish language materials.
